main.name: Michael Tanner
main.description: With a background in aerospace, I iteratively craft expressive code, solve hard problems, and help others alongside bright and motivated teammates.
main.bio: Towards the end of 2018, I was asked to analyze and trend data, past and future, for a rocket engine igniter. I had two options to achieve this goal: do it the usual way or think big. Realizing this, I decided to automate the entire process. This display of ownership along with my excitement to learn something new resulted in a one-touch, web-based interaction to completely analyze and obtain a summary of any number of tests. It also taught me that I love coding and earned me the opportunity to internally transfer to a software team at Blue Origin. I've continued to discover that coding combines several of my favorite things: the iterative crafting of expressive phrases, problem solving, and helping others. Whether it’s a project leader, a colleague, or a client, code always seems to help someone and I relish the resulting sympathetic joy.

education.degree: Graduate Certificate in Software Design & Development
education.description: Beginning at UW this fall after having completed the prereq's at Bellevue College
Received a 4.0 in CS 210, CS 211, and CS 212

Founder of Purdue Barbell (10/13); Staff Reporter at The Purdue Exponent (01/17 – 04/17); Team Leader and Driver for Purdue Grand Prix (01/13 – 05/13); Starter and Safety Officer for Purdue Men’s Water Polo (08/12 – 12/16); Eagle Scout (08/11)
Over the course of 7 months, I engaged in a German work and study abroad program
